00043 static void create_dev_sysfs(struct device *dev);
00044 static void remove_dev_sysfs(struct device *dev);
00045 
00046 #define NDATAMAPPING (NMAPPINGS-1)
00047 
00048 #define MSG_MAPPING (NMAPPINGS-1)
00049 
00050 #define NHANDLERS 16
00051 
00052 #define HANDLERS_SIZE (sizeof(struct ReturnCommandHandler)*NHANDLERS)
00053 
00054 struct PoolEntry {
00055         int reserved;
00056         void* item;
00057 };
00058 
00059 struct BigBufPool {
00060         struct Pool {
00061                 int max_entries;
00062                 struct PoolEntry *entries;
00063                 int cursor;
00064                 char name[16];
00065         }
00066                 mappings, handlers;
00067 
00068         wait_queue_head_t sleepq;
00069 };
00070 
00071 static void _create_mappings(
00072         struct Acq200Device *device,
00073         struct BigBufPool *pool 
00074 )
00075 {
00076         struct DmaBuf *bb = &device->dma_buf;
00077         struct PoolEntry *entries = (struct PoolEntry*)
00078                 KMALLOC(NMAPPINGS*sizeof(struct PoolEntry), GFP_KERNEL);
00079         struct IoMapping *mappings = (struct IoMapping*)
00080                 KMALLOC(sizeof(struct IoMapping)*NMAPPINGS, GFP_KERNEL);
00081 
00082         int ii;
00083         int buflen = dma_buf_len(&device->dma_buf)/NMAPPINGS;
00084         unsigned offset = 0;
00085 
00086         assert(mappings);
00087         assert(entries);
00088 
00089         pool->mappings.entries = entries;
00090         pool->mappings.max_entries = NMAPPINGS;
00091         pool->mappings.cursor = 0;
00092         sprintf(pool->mappings.name, "mappings");
00093 
00094         for (ii = 0; ii != NMAPPINGS; ++ii, offset += buflen){
00095                 struct IoMapping *mapping = &mappings[ii];
00096 
00097                 mapping->va = (u32*)((char*)bb->va + offset);
00098                 mapping->pa = bb->pa + offset;
00099                 mapping->len = buflen;
00100                 sprintf(mapping->name, "buf %d.%d", device->idx, ii );
00101 
00102                 entries[ii].reserved = 0;
00103                 entries[ii].item = mapping;
00104         }
00105 }
00106 
00107 static void _delete_mappings(struct Acq200Device *device)
00108 {
00109         KFREE(device->pool->mappings.entries[0].item);
00110         KFREE(device->pool->mappings.entries);
00111 }
00112 
00113 static void _create_handlers(
00114         struct Acq200Device *device,
00115         struct BigBufPool *pool
00116         )
00117 {
00118         struct PoolEntry *entries = (struct PoolEntry*)
00119                 KMALLOC(NHANDLERS*sizeof(struct PoolEntry), GFP_KERNEL);
00120         struct ReturnCommandHandler* handlers = (struct ReturnCommandHandler*)
00121                 KMALLOC(HANDLERS_SIZE, GFP_KERNEL);
00122         int ii;
00123 
00124         assert(entries);
00125         assert(handlers);
00126 
00127         memset(handlers, 0, HANDLERS_SIZE);
00128 
00129         pool->handlers.entries = entries;
00130         pool->handlers.max_entries = NHANDLERS;
00131         pool->handlers.cursor = 0;
00132         sprintf(pool->handlers.name, "handlers");
00133         
00134         for (ii = 0; ii != NHANDLERS; ++ii){
00135                 rchInit(device, &handlers[ii]);
00136                 entries[ii].reserved = 0;
00137                 entries[ii].item = handlers + ii;
00138         }
00139 }
00140 
00141 static void _delete_handlers(struct Acq200Device *device)
00142 {
00143         KFREE(device->pool->handlers.entries[0].item);
00144         KFREE(device->pool->handlers.entries);
00145         
00146 }
00147 
00148 void acq200_pool_create(struct Acq200Device *device)
00149 {
00150         struct BigBufPool *pool = (struct BigBufPool*)
00151                 KMALLOC(sizeof(struct BigBufPool), GFP_KERNEL);
00152 
00153         memset(pool, 0, sizeof(struct BigBufPool));
00154         _create_mappings(device, pool);
00155         _create_handlers(device, pool);
00156 
00157         pool->mappings.entries[MSG_MAPPING].reserved = 1;
00158         init_waitqueue_head(&pool->sleepq);
00159         device->pool = pool;
00160 
00161         create_dev_sysfs(&device->pci_dev->dev);       
00162 }
00163 
00164 void acq200_pool_delete(struct Acq200Device *device)
00165 {
00166         if (device->pool){
00167                 remove_dev_sysfs(&device->pci_dev->dev);
00168                 _delete_mappings(device);
00169                 _delete_handlers(device);
00170                 KFREE(device->pool);
00171                 device->pool = 0;
00172         }
00173 }

00178 
00179 static void *_alloc(
00180         struct BigBufPool *big_pool,
00181         struct Pool *this_pool)
00182 {
00183 #define INCR(ibuf) (ibuf >= this_pool->max_entries-1? 0: ibuf+1)        
00184         int ibuf;
00185         struct PoolEntry *pe = this_pool->entries;
00186 
00187         for (ibuf = INCR(this_pool->cursor); pe[ibuf].reserved; 
00188                 ibuf = INCR(ibuf)){
00189                 if (ibuf == this_pool->cursor){
00190                         if ( interruptible_sleep_on_timeout(
00191                                      &big_pool->sleepq, 1000) == 0 ){
00192                                 info( " TIMEOUT" );
00193                                 return 0;
00194                         }
00195                 }
00196         }
00197         
00198         this_pool->cursor = ibuf;
00199         pe[ibuf].reserved = 1;
00200         return pe[ibuf].item;
00201 }
00202 
00203 
00204 static void _free(
00205         struct BigBufPool *big_pool, 
00206         struct Pool *this_pool, 
00207         void *item)
00208 {
00209         int ibuf;
00210         struct PoolEntry *pe = this_pool->entries;
00211 
00212         for (ibuf = 0; ibuf != this_pool->max_entries; ++ibuf){
00213                 if (pe[ibuf].item == item){
00214                         pe[ibuf].reserved = 0;
00215                         wake_up_interruptible(&big_pool->sleepq);
00216                         return;
00217                 }
00218         }
00219 
00220         err("FAILED to free item %p", item);
00221 }

00225 struct IoMapping *acq200_pool_alloc_mapping(
00226         struct Acq200Device *device, int direction
00227         )
00228 {
00229         struct IoMapping *map = (struct IoMapping*)_alloc(
00230                 device->pool, &device->pool->mappings);
00231 
00232         dbg(2, "map %p", map);
00233         return map;
00234 }
00235 
00236 void acq200_pool_free_mapping(
00237         struct Acq200Device *device, struct IoMapping *mapping)
00238 {
00239         dbg(2, "free %p", mapping);
00240         _free(device->pool, &device->pool->mappings, mapping);
00241 }

00243 struct ReturnCommandHandler *acq200_pool_alloc_rch(
00244                                 struct Acq200Device *device)
00245 {
00246         struct ReturnCommandHandler *rch =(struct ReturnCommandHandler*)
00247                 _alloc(device->pool, &device->pool->handlers);
00248 
00249         dbg(2, "alloc %p", rch);
00250         return rch;
00251 }
00252 
00253 void acq200_pool_free_rch(
00254         struct Acq200Device *device, struct ReturnCommandHandler *h)
00255 {
00256         dbg(2, "free %p", h);          
00257         _free(device->pool, &device->pool->handlers, h);
00258 }

00262 static ssize_t show_pool(
00263         struct device *dev, 
00264         struct device_attribute *attr,
00265         char * buf)
00266 {
00267         struct Acq200Device *device = acq200_lookupDevice(dev);
00268         int len = 0;
00269         int ii;
00270         struct BigBufPool *bb_pool = device->pool;
00271         struct PoolEntry* pe;
00272 #define FFMT "%20s: "
00273 #define STAPRINT(fmt, field) \
00274         len += sprintf(buf+len,  FFMT fmt "\n", #field, field)
00275 
00276         if (device == 0){
00277                 return sprintf(buf, "ERROR: device not found\n");
00278         }
00279 
00280                 
00281         len += sprintf(buf+len, "MAPPINGS\n");
00282         pe = bb_pool->mappings.entries;
00283         for (ii = 0; ii != bb_pool->mappings.max_entries; ++ii){
00284                 len += sprintf(buf+len, "[%2d] %c %p %d\n",
00285                                ii, ii==bb_pool->mappings.cursor? '*':' ',
00286                                 pe[ii].item, pe[ii].reserved);
00287         }
00288 
00289         len += sprintf(buf+len, "HANDLERS\n");
00290         pe = device->pool->handlers.entries;
00291         for (ii = 0; ii != bb_pool->handlers.max_entries; ++ii){
00292                 struct ReturnCommandHandler *rch = 
00293                         (struct ReturnCommandHandler *)pe[ii].item;
00294 
00295                 len += sprintf(buf+len, 
00296                                 "[%2d] %c %p %d hdlr:%p kbuf %p valid %d\n",
00297                                ii, 
00298                                 ii==bb_pool->handlers.cursor? '*':' ',
00299                                 pe[ii].item, pe[ii].reserved,
00300                                rch->handler, rch->rchReturn.kbuf,
00301                                 rch->rchReturn.valid    );
00302         }
00303         return len;
00304 #undef STAPRINT
00305 }
00306 
00307 static DEVICE_ATTR(pool, S_IRUGO, show_pool, 0);
00308 
00309 
00310 static ssize_t show_rch_list(   struct device *dev, 
00311         struct device_attribute *attr,
00312         char * buf)
00313 {
00314         struct Acq200Device *device = acq200_lookupDevice(dev);
00315         int len = 0;
00316         struct ReturnCommandHandler *rch;
00317 
00318         if (device == 0){
00319                 return sprintf(buf, "ERROR: device not found\n");
00320         }
00321 
00322                 
00323         len += sprintf(buf+len, "RCH LISTING\n");
00324 
00325         list_for_each_entry(rch, &device->m_dpd.rch.list, list){
00326                 len += sprintf(buf+len, 
00327                                 "%p hdlr:%p kbuf %p valid %d path %p\n",
00328                                rch, rch->handler, rch->rchReturn.kbuf,
00329                                rch->rchReturn.valid,
00330                                rch->path  );            
00331         }
00332         return len;
00333 #undef STAPRINT
00334 }
00335 
00336 static DEVICE_ATTR(rch_list, S_IRUGO, show_rch_list, 0);
00337 
00338 static void create_dev_sysfs(struct device *dev)
00339 {
00340         DEVICE_CREATE_FILE(dev, &dev_attr_pool);
00341         DEVICE_CREATE_FILE(dev, &dev_attr_rch_list);
00342 }
00343 
00344 static void remove_dev_sysfs(struct device *dev)
00345 {
00346         device_remove_file(dev, &dev_attr_pool);
00347         device_remove_file(dev, &dev_attr_rch_list);
00348 }
